Title: the rothman disintegration

Scene: Later. Sheldon dribbling ball, approached Kripke, throws it wildly at a pile of mats in the corner.
Later. Kripke, dribbling ball, watched by Sheldon, dribbles it all the way into the back wall.
Later. Kripke chases ball across room chased by Sheldon. Sounds of collision. Sheldon chases ball back across the room chased by Kripke.
Later. Ball hits Sheldon in back of head.
Later. A trampoline has been added. Sheldon tries first, ball hits backboard, bounces back in his face. Kripke tries next, with a run up, ends up crashing into the back wall again.
Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
Raj: It was a nice retirement party.
Hey, look, there’s Rothman’s empty office. Sad.
I’m glad that men are wearing hats again. They’re so distinguished.
Would you look at this? I paid twenty five dollars to some kid on eBay for a handcrafted Harry Potter wand. He sent me a stick. He went into his backyard, he picked up a stick.
How about you decide this with Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock?
Is there anything you’re both equally bad at?
I’m happy for you, Sheldon. But I have to admit I’m going to miss sharing an office with you.
Well, at least you finally got a window that opens. That’s nice.
What, you don’t like wind chimes?
Howard: I guess. Still, it’s a shame Professor Rothman was forced to step down.
I wonder how long Sheldon’s got.
Sheldon, stop. He’s screwing with you.
It’s the 21st century. You can’t have a duel.
Why don’t you just turn up the thermostat?
The growing realization that you are one wacky bastard? Yep.
Leonard: What choice did the university have? He snapped. It happens to theoretical physicists all the time.
Can’t be very long.
Yeah.
You just called dibs.
What’s he doing here?
H-h-h-hang on, Howard. Barry, how good of a shot are you?
It’s gonna be hard to find something you’re both equally good at.
All right, this is one-on-one. First person to five wins the office. Any questions? Yes, Sheldon?
Balls in the basket. (Throws ball to Sheldon)
You know all those terrible things bullies used to do to us?
I get it.
No, he didn’t. Nothing that’s happening here is being done on purpose. Okay, uh, forget one-on-one. Let’s try a free throw contest. First person who makes a basket wins the office.
No. No, I’m not.
All right, we gave it 45 minutes. It’s no longer funny. Let’s try something else.
Uh, on the count of three, both of you bounce the balls as hard as you can. The highest bounce wins the office.
All right, that’s enough trash talk. One, two, three.
Congratulations, Sheldon. You win office.
What are you doing?
Why is there a hole here?
Sheldon, relax.
If you’re not happy, why don’t you just let Kripke have the office?
What happened?
Why would you do that?
Hang in there. I’ll be right back. (Takes out phone and takes a photo. Sits down and starts posting it online.)
Sheldon: These shrimp are all the same size. There’s no the logical order to eat them in.
Mm, indeed.
Dibs.
What are you doing here, Kripke?
This is not your office. It hasn’t been assigned yet.
Dibs? This is a university, not a playground. Offices are not assigned because someone called dibs.
Shut it. Offices are assigned by seniority. I arrived at the university first.
I found him. He’s in the bathroom. President Siebert?
I’m sorry. We just need a word.
We tried. His assistant said he was on sabbatical. Although we distinctly heard his office window open and shut.

Oh, my. President Siebert, I don’t mean to be an alarmist, but difficulty initiating a urine stream could be a symptom of benign prostatic hyperplasia. If you’re interested, I can send you a link to a YouTube video that’ll show you how to perform your own rectal exam. Yeah, uh, helpful hint, trim your nails first.
Oh, he’s just trying to butter you up. And for the record, butter is an excellent lubricant for your rectal exam.
Kripke?
You’re in my spot.
We’re going to work this office situation out like gentlemen. And if that doesn’t work, I’m going to poison his tea.
Kripke. Come in. I’m making tea. Would you like a cup?
Fine. In the interest of preserving our friendship…

Well, that’s a little hard to hear, but all right. As you know, the essence of diplomacy is compromise. With that in mind, I propose the following. I will take Rothman’s office, and you will find a way to be okay with that.
You sure I can’t get you that cup of tea?
Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock was created by Internet pioneer Sam Kass as an improvement on the classic game Rock-Paper-Scissors. All hail Sam Kass.

Oh, it’s very simple. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

Well, of course. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.
Surely. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock…
Is he? Well, then, it seems we have reached an impasse. I see no other option than to challenge you to a duel. I’d smack you with a glove, but just last week I packed away my winter things.
Five what?
Hey! He did that on purpose,
Use the force, Sheldon. Use the force. (Throws ball. It goes about two feet in front of him.) I’m gonna need more force.
What do you propose?
I don’t think so, Kripke. I’ve bounced many a rubber ball in my day.
Who’s unsatisfactory in P.E. now?
Ah, the spoils. I see why victors love them.
Oh, of course you are. Feel free to drop by any time.
Yeah. Call first. (Pushes him out. Closes door. Rothman is standing naked behind it.)
Professor Rothman. This isn’t your office any more. You’re retired.
I’m trying to raise the temperature in here before my nipples tear through my shirt.

Aha! Good question. It turns out the thermostat for my new office isn’t in my new office. No. It’s next door, in Professor Davenport’s office, who is currently enjoying the hot flashes associated with menopause.
Is it? Listen.
No, I hate them, but it gets worse. There it is.
Yeah, It’s completely out of tune with the wind chimes.
You don’t get it, do you? That’s a mockingbird. Mockingbirds can change their song, which means he’s out of tune on purpose. He’s mocking me. Oh dear. There it is again. Do you feel it?

No. The vibration. We are directly underneath the geology lab, and they’re running their confounded sieve shakers again. Hey, gravel monkeys, if you need to shake rocks, try jiggling your heads around!
How can I relax? My nervous system is being stretched out like the strings of a harp and plucked by holes and birds and wind and the low-hanging scrotum of the difficult-to-evict Professor Rothman.

What, and let him win? Do I look crazy to you? We’re trying to think down here, you geode-loving feldspar jockeys! (To the bird) And you, the notes are C, D, E, G and A. You pick one or I am chopping down that tree!
Help! Somebody help!
I was trying to see what was in here and my head got stuck.
It’s called scientific curiosity. Now go get butter.
Kripke: What’s up, fewwas?
Ah, measuwing my new office for dwapes.
Well, I called dibs at the Chwistmas party when Pwofessor Wothman twied to have intercourse with the toys for tots cowwection box.
I awwived at the office first. I’m the pwoverbial earwy bird.
Sheldon, give the man some pwivacy. I’m sowwy. This guy’s got no wespect for boundawies.
Will you tell this wunatic that Pwofessor Wothman’s office is wightfully mine?
Ignore him, Pwesident Siebert. I’m sure a young man such as yourself has a perfectwy healthy pwostate.
Well, as wong as we’re here, I might as well take a weak.
Yes?
Cooper.
Am I weawing a summer fwock? No, I don’t want tea. Wet’s get down to bwass tacks.
We’re not fwiends.
How about I take Wothman’s office, and you go suck a wemon?
What the fwig is that?
How does it work?
I’m sowwy. Can you wepeat that?
Almost got it. One more time.
You have a compwete advantage in twivia. You have an eidetic memowy. Pwus, I haven’t watched Star Twek since I discovered the stwip cwub near my apartment has a fwee buffet.
It’s out, wight?
Time. Wan out of woom.
Making it too easy there, Hofstadter.
Aw wight, Cooper, pwepare to have your heart bwoken. (Throws ball up. It hits the ceiling and doesn’t come down.) Do I get points for that?
Oh, you are going down, Cooper.
Rothman: I think the word you’re looking for is invisible.
Amy: I got you a little something.
What’s huge is what you’ve done for me.

No, no, before I met you, I was a mousy wallflower. But look at me now. I’m like some kind of downtown hipster party girl. With a posse, a boyfriend and a new lace bra that hooks in the front, of all things. Open it. Open it.
I wanted to get you something you didn’t have.
Do you like it?
So, uh, where are you gonna hang it?
No problem.
Oh, what a great movie.
My mother didn’t allow me to watch it. She was afraid it might encourage me to join a gang.
I guess I should get going, too. Good night, painting Penny. Good night, real Penny.
You don’t have to say good night to painting Amy, ’cause she’s never leaving.
Thank you. Wait. Where’d the painting go?
Why?
You hate it.
I feel like an idiot.
Why? So you can just take it down when I leave? I don’t need your pity.
I’m just glad I didn’t go for the sculpture.
Don’t bother.
I’m so humiliated. I sat there the whole time that we were watching Grease, thinking you liked the painting.
I was a fool from Summer Lovin’ to the very last rama lama lama ke ding a de dinga a dong.
Yes, too much. Because our friendship is fundamentally asymmetrical. I clearly like you more than you like me.
I bought you a painting that’s 12 square feet in area. There’s a number.
If you don’t like feet, you can try dollars. The painting set me back three grand.
I’m sorry, I’m just having trouble believing you right now.
No. Damage is done.
Oh, my goodness, how could I have not seen that? The painting is a constant reminder that of the three of us, she is the least cool.
You have such a good heart.
Come on.
We’re going to go put this painting back up in your apartment.
Oh, screw her. She’s just lucky we let her hang out with us.
Little higher on the right.
Little more. No. That’s got it.
I’ll let you in on a little secret.
Originally we were painted nude. But I had him add clothes, ’cause I thought it was an unnecessary challenge to our heterosexuality.
But if you ever change your mind, all it would take is some warm, soapy water and a couple of sponges.
Sure.
Penny: A little something? Oh, it… what, this is huge.
Oh, no, Amy, I haven’t done anything.
Okay. (Opens parcel to find a huge and not at all flattering painting of Penny and Amy)
Wow. I-I don’t know what to s… Wow.
Do I like it? Wow.
Oh, my God. Hang it. Wow. Um, you know, I’d have to go get a hook and nails and a hammer and…
Oh, look. You, huh, you just, you got it all right there. Wow.
So big.
So ugly. What am I gonna do?
Is there any chance I’ll learn to love it?
All right, it’s got to go.
How about I tell her the painting makes you feel jealous because you’re not in it?
Well, I guess I could take it down and put it up when she comes over, but it’s kind of heavy.
I cannot believe you’ve never seen Grease.
Good night, real Amy.
Bye.
Ah, okay. Let us take you off the wall. Out of sight, out of mind. I wish.
Sure, sure. Enjoy. I mean, get it back to me when you can, or, you know what, actually, you keep it. It’s just going to be my gift to you. Bye.
It’s right over there.
I have no idea. That is weird.
No. No, no. It’s just, it’s a little big.
No, come on, you’re not an idiot. Look, just help me put it back up.
Oh, Amy, come on.
I came to say I’m sorry.
Oh, Amy, please.
I know.
You’re right. You’re absolutely right. I should have been honest with you and told you the gift was too much.
I don’t think you can put a number on how much one person likes another.
Amy, come on…
Three gr… Oh, my God! Look, look, Amy, all you need to know is, you are my friend and I don’t want to lose you out of my life.
Grab your hammer.
Okay, look, I didn’t want to say this, but the real reason I took the painting down was because it made Bernadette very jealous.
Yeah, th-th-th-that’s what it is, so…
Huh, I try.
Well where are we going?
Well, what about Bernadette?
How’s that?
Now?
Yeah, okay. That’s, uh, that’s good.
Mm.
Yeah, good call.
You’re talking about the painting, right?
Siebert: Now? You realize I’m your boss, and I am holding my penis?
Can’t you take this up with your department chairman?
Gentlemen, there’s a task I’m trying to accomplish here, and I’m having trouble doing it.

Gentlemen, I’m going to allow the two of you to work this out because A, you’re both brilliant scientists, and B, as far as who gets Rothman’s office, I couldn’t give the furry crack of a rat’s behind.
Bernadette: I don’t know. You can’t take it down. You’ll break her heart. Look at that face. That enormous, unsettling, crazy face.
That depends. Do you like pictures of yourself where you look like a man?
Nuh-uh. What if she gets me one? I already have a picture of me and Howard’s mom getting our hair cornrowed in Venice Beach. I’ve suffered enough.
Mmm, too bad you’re not as strong as the dude in the painting.
I’ve got to go. I’ve got to get up early. My company’s testing a new steroid that supposedly doesn’t shrink testicles, and the last one there has to do the measuring.
Amy (entering): You know, can I borrow that movie? Those singing hooligans really got my motor running.
